rComments: Shelly  does not post any lecture notes, does not provide a study guide, and does not seem to take any constructive criticism from her students. Her lectures are very fast paced and she assigns too many writing assignments. I started off liking her class in the beginning but was annoyed and frustrated by her style of teaching towards the end.

Shelly is an inspirational and respectable professor. She does amazing research and work beyond the classroom. She provides a very critically engaging and rewarding learning experience in her class. Very interesting class. Above average workload. Very fast lecturer though and not the most clear with exams, pretty tough exams, writing intensive.

The professor worked my butt off all quarter with 2 pg essays due every class. But now that it's over I'm glad I had an ears deep immersion into feminist theory and sexism. And I must add she is the hottest professor I was ever taught by.

Shelly is an amazing lecturer.  She makes her claims and supports them with research that has been done on those topics. Reading load is heavy there were one page assignments that were basically a free write due weekly. Three exams all open ended questions and engaged critical thinking and a five page final paper. Easy if you work hard and attend
Shelly is clearly passionate about her work. She refuses to "water down" her lessons and holds her students to high standards. This class was not easy, but it was very interesting.

Had my mind blown almost every single class. Will challenge you and develop your critical thinking skills. Some people may not dig her style, since part of what she teaches is that, in life, there are no easy answers. Doesn't give study guide because wants to give you agency over your own learning. Don't take if you want to be spoon-fed.

Grabe was not a good professor, the subject matter that she taught was important/interesting, and her lectures were organized/informative, but she herself was unfair and seemed unfriendly, her exams were very very difficult, she did not give any study guides, she made simple concepts seem too complex, and she does not answer questions via email.
My favorite professor at UCSC, hands down.

Interesting class but her tests straight up suck. They are really hard to study for; it's a shot in the dark for what questions she is going to ask so just do the readings, review your notes, and keep your fingers crossed. It was my only B in an upper division psych class...

Shelly embodies everything I hope to be in the future. She really cares about her students and wants to challenge them intellectually. She refuses to have her students consume and regurgitate information. Only critical thinking will get you by in this class. There is a lot of reading, but Shelly highlights the important points in her lectures.

Shelly is one of my favorite professors at UCSC. Her classes are interesting, relevant and real. I love that she actually engages with her students during lecture instead of just lecturing at us the entire time. She is an inspiration to women who are planning on entering the field of academia.

Shelly rules. Take her class, take the material seriously and you will learn lots. Working together with classmates can truly help as well. She doesn't provide study guides. Make your own study guide with google docs, work together, and you will all succeed.

This class has an extremely high amount of homework and although she does not take attendance if you miss class you will definitely miss something important for the exam, which you will have no way of getting back because she does not post any notes or study guides.

My review will have nothing about how Shelly looks but will instead focus on how to succeed in her class? the tests are short answer/multiple choice and are based solely off her lectures.   be very knowledgeable of the studies she gives. If you put a considerable effort into the class and go to every lecture, you?ll do great.

Shelly is gorgeous.  That statement goes against everything I've learned about women this quarter though.  Did not look forward to taking this class as a male, but now that it's over, I have a better view of myself and women in reality and how my actions impact others.  The amount of work is outrageous but makes you such a better student.

Shelly is amazing, and her class totally changed the way I view my place in society. She's friendly, helpful and smart, and she works really hard to get you engaged in the material. I can't say enough good things about her - take this class!

Amazing class. Shelly was able to make all her lectures interesting and thought provoking. It opened my eyes to a lot about women's bodies that I never thought about. The readings were very well chosen. This class really makes you think as opposed to memorizing info only to spit it back out. Highly recommended.

Shelly is a wonderful professor. She is extremely respectful, brilliant, and makes lectures interesting.  Her exams are about your ability to think rather than memorization... which is awesome. I'm glad someone finally caught on to what teaching should be about!

This class was extremely rewarding for me. I now look at our culture in a different way. No book, just articles on ERES. Not too bad on the amount of readings. Very interesting subject matter than you won't get in other classes. Shelly treats her students w/ respect & like her peers, not condescending as other profs do. Definitely recommended!
